Fields.DialogueText: L-3, we have a message from the Motherland. We've been given our next task.
May I read it?
Of course. It's a little light on details, but here you go.
Hmmm... They talk as if only I could handle this assignment.
Yeah, I did notice that. Practically every other sentence was a compliment for you. They were laying it on pretty thick.
You think I don't deserve the praise?

Fields.MenuText: I wouldn't say that. I just don't want you getting a big head.
I'm not sure. I mean, you're just doing your job.
I think you deserve all that and more. I just wasn't expecting it.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, no need to worry. My head will stay just as it is.
Exactly. At least you understand.
Of course you'd think that. I don't know why I would think anything else.
The fact is that I am no more invaluable than any one of my comrades. I simply do what any one of them would do in my place.
I'm not so sure about that. I don't know another Belle that lays mines quite like you.
Hmph. I suppose if people must see me as a champion of the fleet, that at least paints Mother Russia in a positive light.
That's a good way to look at it, because I have a feeling that as long as you keep taking missions like this, people are going to keep seeing you as a hero.
A hero? I'm a soldier. I will do the task assigned to me, but all this praise... it will not go to my head.
*ALARM*
Well, hero, we've got more villains to vanquish.
I'll prepare the mines.
@BATTLE
L-3, I think we need to talk about this mission we've been given.
I agree. I think it's about time we get underway. There isn't any time to waste.
Not so fast. I reached out to some of my contacts in the area, and they gave me a few more details about this Morgana we've been tasked with dispatching.
Do tell. We should know as much as possible about our enemy before we head into battle.
There's a group of Morganas that have been assaulting ports for some time now. They appear without warning, bypassing any defenses and leaving the town decimated.
Bypassing defenses? Sounds like the work of submarines, perhaps.
That's what they're thinking. Except... the description we have for the Morgana leading the assaults doesn't match that. Survivors have described it as a ship the size of a small island.
Perhaps it's a submarine the size of a small island. We're not quite sure how Morganas operate, so that could explain it. Either way, I suppose we'll find out when we destroy it.
You're still ready to take on something that could be five times your size?
Are you not?

Fields.MenuText: No, I am. I'm just making sure you are.
I'd be lying if I said I wasn't a little apprehensive.
I'm scared out of my pants. I think we should turn this mission down.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm always ready, Kapitan. I figured you'd know that by now.
Well, that's understandable. The fear of death is what keeps us alive, after all.
You want to turn it down? You really don't know all that much about Mother Russia, do you?
This Morgana has been causing havoc, and we've been given the privilege of defeating it. No matter how large it may be. Besides, it wouldn't be very heroic of me to run away, now would it?
Oh, so now you think you're some kind of big shot?
I can play the part. For the Motherland.
*ALARM*
Let's see if you can play that part while under fire.
As if I'm ever anything other than calm under fire.
@BATTLE
What's taking so long? Shouldn't we already be done resupplying?
You'd be surprised how long it takes to load all the mines you use.
We might want to double the usual amount. If this Morgana is as big as they say, we might need some extra ordnance.

Fields.MenuText: Not the worst idea in the world, though it will take some more time.
Okay, we'll load up the sub with explosives, take one shot and blow ourselves out of the water.
And how are you planning on paying for all these extra mines?

Fields.DialogueText: It won't be necessary, Kapitan. I wasn't being serious.
No need to overreact, I was simply joking. Was that not obvious?
A pragmatic view. You're exactly right. Ordnance is expensive.
I can make do with however many mines we have. No need to actually get extra.
*ALARM*
Unless we use too many in this next fight.
I'll do my best to be frugal.
@BATTLE
Kapitan, I have something I'd like you to take a look at.
What is it? A book?
It's... the start of my... I'm not really sure what to call it. My view of the world... or how I think it should be, maybe.
Right, you were working on publishing your ideas on communism. How's it been going?
I'm... no writer. It's one thing to prepare reports for back home, but this... it's much harder.

Fields.MenuText: What could be so hard? Just grab a pen and get going.
I understand. Writing reports is impersonal. This is anything but.
I wouldn't know. I know two things: fighting and leading.

Fields.DialogueText: You make it sound much easier than it actually is.
Exactly. It makes me feel vulnerable. I don't like it.
Well, it's a bit like fighting, only the enemy is yourself.
You don't usually have a problem voicing your opinions, L-3.
There's something different about putting the words on paper. I feel like they need to be perfect. And I'm sure they're not.
It's a rough draft. That's to be expected.
Of course. I'd just appreciate it if you could look it over and tell me what you think about it.
It'd be my pleasure.
Thank you, Kapitan. I'll leave you to it.
@BATTLE
She's truly an inspiration. I'm so lucky to have been placed on her crew.
She is very impressive, but don't get all creepy on me now.
I'm not creepy! I just want to be just like her.
Just like who?
Oh, Captain. I was talking about L-3, of course.
Hey, you spend a lot of time with her. Is she as amazing as they say she is?

Fields.MenuText: Even more so.
Not really. She's just a normal person like you or me.
You're acting like you've never talked to her yourself.

Fields.DialogueText: Really? I knew L-3 was the right person to be my role model.
Like me? I wish. She's so much more than normal. She's the strongest person I've ever seen.
Me? Talk to her? No way. I... I wouldn't want to disappoint her!
Excuse me, Kapitan. You're needed on deck.
I-I-I-It's her...
Be cool. Don't make a fool of yourself.
I'll be right there. Thank you.
... Is there a reason you're staring at me?
I... I just... Ummmm...
She's a fan. Of you and your heroic deeds.
My heroic... I see. Thank you, but I just do job as part of the Red Fleet.
... So humble.
We're just gonna go now. Nice talk to you both.
Are you blushing, L-3?
That was embarrassing. I've never met a... fan before. What am I supposed to do?
I think you handled it pretty well. Don't worry about it too much. Now wasn't I needed on deck?
Yes, that's right. There are Morganas in the area. We need a plan of action.
Always with the Morganas. I can't even finish one meal.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
More Morganas. I think I'm actually more comfortable fighting them than entertaining my fans!
@BATTLE
L-3, have you seen our mine stores?
Are we already running low? I've been trying to use the absolute minimum.

Fields.MenuText: You could've fooled me.
I know, but I think you and I have different definitions for that word.
You've actually been doing better than I expected.

Fields.DialogueText: I've hardly been leaving any mines in our wake after skirmishes.
I use as many as I need to get the job done, and no more. What's your definition?
Thank you. I'm glad you can appreciate my restraint.
You're just a little too trigger happy with the mines, and at this point I'm worrying about it more from a supply point of view.
First you're worried about safety, now you're worried about supply. I'm beginning to wonder if you really want to defeat these Morganas.
Come on. You know that if I wasn't here to rein you in, we'd find ourselves in the middle of a skirmish without any artillery.
You're... probably right. That doesn't mean I'm going to give up fighting for more mines.
I wouldn't expect you to.
L-3, can I pull you aside for a second?
I... da?
I've given your rough draft a read through.
Already? That was faster than I expected.

Fields.MenuText: I had a lot of free time. Surprisingly enough.
I made it a priority to read it as soon as I could.
Well, I skimmed it. Most of it. More or less.

Fields.DialogueText: That is surprising. You're usually quite busy as captain. Not to mention the Morgana skirmishes.
A priority? I'm flattered. You didn't need to do that.
That makes more sense. The idea that you had read it so soon was a little unbelievable.
So what did you think?
Well, you have a lot of good thoughts in here. It's just a little rough around the edges.
Can you elaborate?
It's... a little disorganized. Kind of hard to follow.
I see.
Then there are a few light grammatical mistakes. Nothing big, but noticeable.
Mhmmm...
It was also just a little cold. The voice of it, I mean. You know what I mean.
There are... quite a few issues. More than I thought.
It was a rough draft. You shouldn't take any of these to heart.
No... I understand that. It's just a little disheartening.
*ALARM*
We can go over it more later. I didn't mean to hurt your feelings or anything, L-3.
Don't worry about it, Kapitan. We have more pressing matters.
@BATTLE
You know, L-3, I actually think I am enjoying discussing your book with you.  I would like to do that more, if you agree.
Certainly, I'd be--
*ALARM*
Well, war isn't really about doing what we want...
@BATTLE
L-3, perfect. I was hoping we could find a chance to talk more about your writing.
That's not why I'm here. And actually, I think I've heard enough about that for the time being.
I didn't mean--
Kapitan, haven't you noticed the increases in Morganas lately?
... I have. The closer we get to our destination, the more Morganas we encounter.
Exactly. That's why I laid a fair portion of our remaining mines in the wake of that last battle.

Fields.MenuText: You did that without my authorization!?
Smart. That might buy us some time.
That was dangerous, L-3.

Fields.DialogueText: I made a judgment call. We should have enough artillery to handle anymore Morganas before we restock.
I'm glad you approve. I was worried you might be angry with me.
If there's anyone sailing these Morgana infested waters, a few mines are the least of their worries.
I suppose if you're going to keep littering the water with your mines, we ought to head to port.
Exactly why I came to see you.
Well, you got what you wanted. Time to pick up some more mines.
So I think I know why the waters are so thick with Morganas.
Did you overhear something in the port?
Yeah, everyone's talking about "The Storm". It seems to be what they're calling the Morganas that have been attacking ports nearby.
The Storm sounds like an interesting opponent. I look forward to destroying them.
Apparently they were followed by an unusually high number of Morganas. Not enough to really threaten our patrols, but enough to distract them.
So these stealthy submarines can find their way to ports and bombard them. I can appreciate the tactic.
They're tossing Morganas out as distractions. You wouldn't do something like that with our ships, would you?
If it was necessary. It wouldn't be my first idea, but we have to win the war effort.

Fields.MenuText: That's pretty cold.
You're pretty ruthless. I think I like it.
Anything for Mother Russia, right?

Fields.DialogueText: The battlefield is not a place for warmth, Kapitan.
I'm glad you approve. Sometimes lives are sacrificed for the greater good.
Exactly. Communism is worth fighting and dying for.
Knowing their tactics is good, though. We know where to look for them.
From what it sounds like, the leader should be pretty hard to miss.
The ocean is a big place.
@BATTLE
Kapitan, any luck finding the Storm yet?
It is possible, but--
*ALARM*
Another distraction.
Then we have extra reason to terminate it.
@BATTLE
I was hoping we would've found this Storm by now. If I could get a glimpse of them I could start to think about strategy.
Well, it's your lucky day. Though I can't say the same for the community they just destroyed.
The Storm struck again? Where?
A port nearby. They were in and out like a flash of lightning... hence the name, unfortunately.
We have to hurry there. If we're quick we should be able to get a look at our enemy.

Fields.MenuText: My thought exactly.
You want to run headfirst into a group of Morganas that just destroyed a town?
We need to be careful about this. We can't go running in without a plan.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm glad we're on the same page, Kapitan.
Do you have another idea? Please, provide us with another option.
And we can't develop a plan when all we know about our target is rumor and legend.
No more time to talk. If we take to long, we could miss our chance.
Let's hope those aren't our last words.
That sure is a big Morgana.
Far larger than any normal submarine. Though I suppose that Morganas aren't exactly normal.
All the smaller Morganas swimming around it look like flies in comparison.
If we can just get a closer look, I think we could get a better idea of its weaknesses.

Fields.MenuText: We shouldn't get too close. We don't want to risk it seeing us.
Then let's push forward. We're so small compared to it that it shouldn't notice us.
Maybe just a little. Remember, this is only surveillance.

Fields.DialogueText: You make a good point, Kapitan. But we need to see it.
I hope you're right, Kapitan, but I'll have my mines prepared just in case.
But right now all that we've surveilled is that it's big. We need more information.
*EXPLOSION*
*ALARM*
Look like it's more perceptive than we thought.
This isn't good. They're all turning to face us.
And here I thought we were being so stealthy.
We need to fight them off and make a tactical retreat.
I couldn't agree more. Let's go.
@BATTLE
That was too--
Look out, more coming!
@BATTLE
That was too close.
I agree. We should've stayed further away. However, at least we got a nice close up look this way.

Fields.MenuText: Yeah, when it almost ate us.
You think we learned anything valuable from that encounter?
Next time we run into that thing, I'm stuffing it and mounting it on my wall.

Fields.DialogueText: I would not have let that happen. Becoming lunch for a Morgana hardly seems like a worthy way to die for the Motherland.
We did. I'm already starting to develop plans of attack in my head.
You may need a bigger wall, Kapitan. Though, I approve of the confidence.
We should return to port, resupply, and talk tactics.
I agree. I'll get started on some strategies right away.
I look forward to hearing them.
Kapitan, I think I've come up with a strategy that should leave our target open for attack.
I'm all ears.
We know they attack ports, and we know they're in and out before aid can arrive.
So my suggestion is we lay in wait, hidden near a port. When they arrive and start to attack, we swoop in and lay mines under them to float up and destroy the majority of the force.
Then we can handle the oversized leader on it's own.
Interesting, but I have a question or two.
And I have answers.

Fields.MenuText: You want to wait until they start bombing a port before we attack?
They spotted us once. What's to make you think they won't spot us again?
How many mines are we going to need to destroy all those ships?

Fields.DialogueText: Yes. Of course, the hope is that we can interrupt them before they completely destroy it. There are times that sacrifices must be made.
We'll be lying in wait, we won't be moving until they're already distracted with the town. They won't notice us until they're exploding.
A lot. Which is why I've already been working on plans to convert some of our other artillery into makeshift mines.
My biggest issue with this plan is that if it doesn't work we'll be face to face with the entirety of the Storm again. That didn't go so well last time.
We weren't defeated last time. It was a tactical retreat. This next time will be different. I'll defeat them for Russia.
I'll need to think about this.
Think fast. The longer you take to decide, the more ports are destroyed.
Thanks, but I don't need the reminder.
@BATTLE
Kapitan, we're resupplied and ready to engage. Have you decided on our plan of attack?
I have. I trust you, L-3. Your plan seems a little dangerous, but if you're sure about this, I'm prepared to follow you.
Thank you, Kapitan. I appreciate your trust in me. You won't regret this.

Fields.MenuText: I hope not. Either this works or we end up in pieces at the bottom of the ocean.
I'm already regretting this. We're dead.
Of course not. You've never been wrong before.

Fields.DialogueText: I'll be doing everything I can to make sure that doesn't happen.
At least then we'll take the Morganas with us.
I believe you may have too high of an opinion of me. I'm not perfect.
So what will we be needing to make this plan of yours work?
As many mines as we can get our hands on.
I should've guessed.
*ALARM*
We'll head back to port as soon as we deal with these Morganas.
Sounds like a plan. I'll try to refrain from using too many mines in this battle. They'd serve us better at a later date.
@BATTLE
That was a productive visit to the port. I feel very full.
It was wise of you to visit the port before the Storm could destroy it.
If that was a joke, it was not funny.
I am not so certain it was a joke. That is a reasonable expectation with this enemy.
*ALARM*
Speak of the devil.
@BATTLE
We're carrying as many mines as we can hold, Kapitan. We should be very careful as we wait for the Storm to attack. We're basically a submersible powder keg.

Fields.MenuText: You're joking, right?
What a glorious end that would be for L-3, champion of The Red Fleet.
We may have to move at a snail's pace, but it'll be worth it if it works.

Fields.DialogueText: No. I'm being serious. One good hit and we could be wiped from the map.
Don't even joke about that. I'm planning on dying defending Mother Russia.
It'll work. If I was at all uncertain, I'd tell you.
Oh, Kapitan, there was something else.
What is it?
I've been... I started working on the second draft of my book. It's nowhere near finished, but I tried to work on everything you commented on. Here.
Oh, it has a cover now. It looks nice.
It's not hardbound or anything, but I did what I could. I was hoping you could...
Read through it and give you more notes?
That... and I was hoping you could keep it with you for the upcoming battle.
Sure. It could be my good luck charm.
I appreciate that, Kapitan. Now, I'm sure there are still some preparations that I need to make. If you'll excuse me.
*ALARM*
Here come the Morganas. Time to test that good luck charm you gave me.
Now that I think of it more, I'm not sure an avowed Marxist such as myself should be believing in such things.
Well, if you could call anything such, it would be a book about communism by an avowed Marxist such as yourself.
Perhaps. Time to fight.
@BATTLE
It feels like we've been waiting here for way too long.
It hasn't been that long.
We could be fighting Morganas right now. Protecting people.
This is how we protect the most people. Soon the Storm will strike and we'll be here. Ready for the kill.
Hey... L-3, are you really not afraid of dying?
What kind of question is that?
You were just... This is a risky plan, and you've expressed your willingness to die for your country before.
I am willing to die for my country, if necessary. If my death, if anyone's death is able to serve a bigger purpose, then it's a death worth having.

Fields.MenuText: What about the people who would rather see you alive?
Personally, I think you can do more for your country in life than in death.
But you don't want to die, do you?

Fields.DialogueText: You mean my supposed "fans?" I'm sure they'd tell the story of my courageous final battle. And the Red Fleet's reputation would be better for it.
I agree. That's why I never plan on dying. I'm just always ready for it.
No, Kapitan. I don't want to die. Does that make you feel better?
In the end, Kapitan. Everyone has to die. I just want to make sure my death has meaning.
I suppose I can appreciate that. As long as you keep trying to live.
I will. I can promise you that.
*EXPLOSION*
Sounds like the fighting has started.
And just as I suspected, they have no idea we're here.
We have to move stealthily as we close in to unload our mines. How long will it take to make sure we catch them all in our trap?
Too long if we're careful. We're going to have to do this fast.
But then they'll notice us.
By the time they know what we're doing, it'll be too late. Trust me.

Fields.MenuText: We need to be careful about this. That's that.
Okay, fast and dirty it is. Let's do this your way.
Isn't there some kind of nice middle ground we can aim for?

Fields.DialogueText: Fine. As you order, Kapitan.
Thank you, Kapitan. This is the right move, I assure you.
I suppose. If you really can't make up your mind.
And we should start to hear the damage... Now.
*EXPLOSION*
Ahhh! That was closer than I thought it would be.
L-3! Are you okay?!
I'm fine. We don't have time to worry about me. It looks like they know we're down here.
Prepare for battle!
@BATTLE
That was rough, but you actually pulled through.
I expected as much.
*ALARM*
I expect to again.
@BATTLE
*EXPLOSION*
The rest of those mines really took care of those Morganas.
All but one. The leader still stands.
And you're just barely holding on. The Morganas weren't the only ones caught in the blast.
I'm fine. We're so close to victory! We can't run now.

Fields.MenuText: Are you sure you can do this? You look like you're having trouble standing.
If you fall, the entire submarine falls. You're not only risking your own life here.
If anyone can do this... Don't die on me, L-3.

Fields.DialogueText: You've seen me at my worst, Kapitan. This is... far from it.
We're all prepared to fight to the death. That's part of fighting for the Motherland.
I can do this, Kapitan. I'll do my utmost best to stay alive.
Captain, L-3, we've got Morgana reinforcements approaching our position.
Looks like we're fighting. Let's do this. Together.
Together.
Hey, L-3?  Do you plan to continue your book?
If I survive this, definitely.
Then I recommend putting this battle in the next revision.
@BATTLE
It's... is it done?
You did it, L-3!
I knew we could... do it.
L-3... are you okay?
I'm just... I think I need some water...
Hey, are you sure you're okay? You're staggering.
I don't... I...

Fields.MenuText: Let's get you to the infirmary.
I'll go get you some water, okay? Just stay right there.
Eh, you'll be fine. Walk it off.

Fields.DialogueText: You know I'm still a little... I'm not a fan of doctors and...
I'm not... going anywhere.
You're probably... right... I just need to...
L-3! Someone help me bring her to the infirmary! There's something wrong with L-3!
Ugghhh...
L-3? Are you coming to?
Where... Where am I?
The infirmary. You got pretty banged up in that fight. You collapsed as soon as it ended.
The infirmary? Did it have to be the infirmary?

Fields.MenuText: It was that or die.
Calm down, they didn't do much to you. You've mostly just been sleeping.
I know, I'm sorry. I was just worried about you.

Fields.DialogueText: Well... that wouldn't have exactly been a fitting death, would it?
Okay, that makes it a little easier on me. Thank you, Kapitan.
You were worried? Was it really that bad?
How long have you been here waiting for me to wake up?
I've been here from the second you collapsed.
Don't you have more important things to do than stay at my bedside?
No. You're my priority, L-3.
I... am?
Not to mention the fact that the waters have gotten a lot calmer without the Storm causing trouble.
*ALARM*
You were saying?
Well, the Morganas aren't gone. Though it looks like you chose the right time to wake up. Think you're up for a skirmish?
I think I've spent long enough in bed. Let's get out of here before any doctors want to check me out.
@BATTLE
L-3! I'm so happy to see you back on your feet! How are you feeling?
I'm back at a hundred percent.
Of course you are. Nothing can keep you down for too long.
We should celebrate, shouldn't we?
Oh, that's a wonderful idea! We can celebrate your recovery, L-3!
Actually I meant we should celebrate our victory.
Yeah, whatever. That too then.
What do you think, Kapitan? Has the crew earned a celebration?

Fields.MenuText: Not even a little.
Of course. I've been waiting for the opportunity to have a party.
I'm more interested to know what you think, L-3.

Fields.DialogueText: That's a little cruel, don't you think, Kapitan? They fought well.
Well, here it is. The crew is clamoring for it too.
I understand everyone could use a respite from war.
All right, looks like we're having a party.
Fantastic! I'll spread the news! This is going to be so awesome!
Hey, don't run off without me!
They seem excited.
Aren't you?
We'll see.
@BATTLE
Finally a chance to start the party.
This vodka looks glorious!
A toast to Mother Russia and her finest daughter, L-3!
*ALARM*
After this, if we survive.
And if the vodka glasses don't spill.
@BATTLE
L-3? What are you doing here? You're missing the party.
The party is more for the crew. I... wanted to be alone.

Fields.MenuText: Should I take that as my cue to leave?
Okay, I'll let you be alone then.
That doesn't seem right. This party is for you.

Fields.DialogueText: No, you can stay. I like your company.
Actually... would you mind keeping me company for a bit?
It's for the crew. They're still able to celebrate.
So what are we working on in here?
I was just doing a little writing. Working on my ideas for communism.
Right. I actually finished your second draft while you were out.
This is embarrassing. Honestly, I had forgotten I'd given that to you.
Well, maybe you should've kept it. It was a pretty good luck charm for me. I was hardly touched in battle.
I'm glad to hear that.
So what did you think? Was it an improvement from the previous draft?
It was. It wasn't perfect, but I definitely think you're heading in the right direction.
If you don't have to hurry back to the party... would you consider staying here and letting me bounce some ideas off you?
Sounds like fun. Even more so than the party.
I doubt that, but thank you.
Actually, would you please grab us a blanket big enough to share? It's getting a little chilly.
Sure. But again, you could just get a coat.
I don't need one.
I'll be right back with a blanket.
Of course.
L-3, where were you during the party? I looked all over for you and I couldn't find you anywhere.
My apologies. I was with the Kapitan. We were working on something together.
You two were just... working on something together? Alone?

Fields.MenuText: It's not like that.
Yeah, and we were just snuggling under a blanket.
What's with the smirk?

Fields.DialogueText: I didn't say anything. But it sounds like you're protesting a little too strongly.
You were snuggling under a blanket!? This is blowing my mind!
I'm just surprised to hear that you two spent all that time alone together. It's interesting.
I had no idea that you two had that kind of relationship.
We have grown very close.
I can see that. Now, if you'll excuse me, I have something completely unrelated to talk to my friend about.
That was an abrupt exit. Did I say something offensive?
L-3... she thinks we were sneaking away together during the party in a... romantic sense.
Oh? Oh! I didn't realise she was making that kind of an assumption.
*ALARM*
There's bigger things to deal with now.
Morganas. There's no getting rid of them.
@BATTLE
Again, I'm incredibly sorry about this, Kapitan.
There's nothing to worry about, L-3. So she started some rumors. It's no big deal.
Some of these rumors have gotten... embarrassingly graphic. I cannot stress enough how apologetic I am about this.

Fields.MenuText: Graphic, you say? Do tell.
There are worse things they could be spreading around the ship.
I'm the one who should be sorry. You're the one with the reputation of a champion.

Fields.DialogueText: You want me to tell you? Like, the details? I wouldn't dare repeat that aloud.
I just feel horrible about being partly responsible for damaging your reputation like this.
I didn't even think about that. I've been too worried about your good name.
You have to stop worrying, L-3. It's not such a bad thing.
Yes, it... wait. Do you mean them thinking we're an item or actually being an item?
It can't be that much of a surprise, can it? That I might have feelings for you?
You have feelings for me?
I said I might.
*ALARM*
We can talk about this more after the battle. But if you just decide you have no time for matters of the heart, I'll understand.
Wait... Kapitan, you can't just leave me with that. How am I supposed to go into battle with a clear head like this!?
@BATTLE
L-3? Are you...
Please. Me first.
Oh... kay?
Okay, be plain with me, Kapitan.
Do you have feelings for me?

Fields.MenuText: You're a fantastic person, L-3. Of course I have feelings for you.
Do you have feelings for me?
What if I said I didn't?

Fields.DialogueText: That's what I expected you to say. It's also what I was hoping you'd say.
I asked you first.
I'd be hurt... But I'd also have trouble believing you.
I honestly thought it was a little obvious how I felt for you.
I don't worry about romance all that much.
But it would seem that I have feelings for you and you have feelings for me...
You have feelings for me? I'm glad to finally hear that.
So then we should pursue this, yes?
Wait, what? That's sudden.
Well, shouldn't we see if we can have a relationship?
Just like that?
Are you free tomorrow? We can go on a date.
Wait a minute. I've got something I want to say before this goes any further.
What is it? Do you not want to date me?
No, it's not that. I just... I don't want you to keep making risky decisions. Even if it's for Russia. If we're gonna do this, you can't be so willing to die.
... I can do that. For you.
That means a lot, L-3.
Now, where would you like to go on our date? We don't have as many options as I would like, being on a submarine.
*ALARM*
As long as there aren't Morganas involved, I'll be happy.
If Morganas ruin our first date, they will regret it.
@BATTLE
